summary: The 'Firefighter Investments to Recognize Exposure to Cancer Act of 2025' amends the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 to establish cancer prevention programs specifically for firefighters. It authorizes grants for multi-cancer early detection testing and other preventative tests, with a maximum amount per test. The bill also authorizes $700 million in appropriations for these programs and mandates a joint FEMA and CDC program for firefighters to share anonymized test results to identify cancer trends. A technical amendment in regards to subsection references is also included.
